todos.title: End
todos.body: With you headline, key theme, and advice.

todos.title: Three types of learners
todos.body: Visual (sight), auditory (sound), and kinesthetic (touch).  Incorporate something for all of them.

todos.title: Headline
todos.body: The one big idea you want to leave with your audience.

todos.title: Slide/Script/Delivery Method Table
todos.body: Put your slide text, script text, and delivery method (pauses, inflection, tone) in columns in a table next to each other.

todos.title: Inspiring Communicators
todos.body: Create something meaningful out of esoteric or everyday products.  Your widget doesn't inspire me.  Show me how your widget improves my life, and you've won me over.

todos.title: Presentation Elements
todos.body: Conflict, resolution, villains, and heroes.

todos.title: Analogies
todos.body: Comparison between two different things to highlight area of similarity.  Ex   It's like the microprocessor for your brain.

todos.title: 10 min
todos.body: Your audience checks out after ten minutes, not a second later.  You need to finish in this time or transitions to something exciting, different, a video, etc.

todos.title: Why should I care
todos.body: You need to answer why customers should care about this.  If you don't you will fail.  Audience doesn't care about your product, they care about themselves and how it meets their needs.  Sell dreams, not products.

todos.title: PLAIN ENGLISH CAMPAIGN
todos.body: Write in plain English so everyone can understand you.  Avoid big words and complex terminology.  Usingenglish.com.

todos.title: Share The Stage
todos.body: With customers, audience members, partners, employees, etc.

todos.title: Punch
todos.body: When you're ready, don't be afraid to land the first punch at competitors.

todos.title: Ultimate Elevator Pitch
todos.body: What do you do, what problem do you solve, how are you different, why should I care.

todos.title: Different
todos.body: We want to sell to people that have always wanted to be a little different.

todos.title: Charisma
todos.body: Using people's first name, looking at them in the eyes with a laser like stare.  Rhythm of speech.

todos.title: Metaphors
todos.body: Using a familiar term that people are familiar with but then highlighting the difference.  Its like the '.  For'.

todos.title: Use Props
todos.body: Use props.

todos.title: Rule of three
todos.body: Two is too few things, and four is too many to remember.  Every point should have three or less things.  Three is the magic number.

todos.title: Complex Ideas
todos.body: The more complex the idea, the more important to use rhetorical devices such as analogies and metaphors to facilitate understanding.

todos.title: Hero
todos.body: The heroes job is not necessarily to crush the bad guy, it is to make our lives better.

todos.title: Roadmap
todos.body: Tell the audience the three things that you are going to show them before you show them.

todos.title: Bucket Method
todos.body: Take any question you've ever been asked and put it into a bucket so you have common responses for categories of questions.

todos.title: Software
todos.body: Start with the customer experience and work backward to the technology.

todos.title: Passion
todos.body: Some entrepreneurs are afraid to express emotion about their dream but it is passion and emotion that will attract and motivate others.

todos.title: Language
todos.body: Should be simple, non technical, specific, short, emotional, descriptive.  Insecure manager and entrepreneurs create complexity to inflate their ego.

todos.title: Perseverance
todos.body: Separates successful entrepreneurs from the unsuccessful ones.

todos.title: Anaphora
todos.body: Repetition of the same words in consecutive sentences.  Ex  I have a dream'

todos.title: Narration
todos.body: Present words in a narration, not a visual on-screen text.

todos.title: Practice
todos.body: Practice 1 hour for every minute you pitch.  Never practice alone.  Record yourself presenting and play it back to yourself.

todos.title: Put Numbers in Context
todos.body: People don't understand what 5GB or 3G is.  They do understand the concepts of 1,000 songs in your pocket, twice as fast, watch the difference.  Address things in context.  Show the difference side by side.

todos.title: Simplification
todos.body: Most important part of Apple's design process.  Keep slides simple.  If you can't explain something simply, you don't know it well enough.

todos.title: Eye Contact
todos.body: Memorize everything so you can stare into audience's eyes.

todos.title: Common terms
todos.body: It's like, more of what they love, twice as, half the, just one click, most, greenest, reinvents, fastest, what we've found in our research, why do you need this, who cares, quantum leap, one more thing, look back, extraordinary, thank you, it feels great, how thrilled I am,

todos.title: Pictures
todos.body: It is better to present an explanation in words and pictures.  People remember 10 percent of oral presentations and about 65% when you add pictures.

todos.title: Introduce Antagonist
todos.body: Introduce an antagonist, an enemy, and a problem, in need of a solution.

todos.title: Core Values
todos.body: Individuals are inspired by core values and a sense of purpose.

todos.title: Personal Passion Statement
todos.body: In one sentence, tell your prospects why you are genuinely excited about working with them.

todos.title: Twitter Like Headlines
todos.body: Headlines you create that work so well that media will use them word for word.  Ex   World's thinnest notebook. Must be specific, memorable and can fit in a twitter post.  They need to use third grader English.  Ex   A thousand songs that can fit in your pocket.   Consistently repeat your headline.

todos.title: Nine Elements of Great Presentation
todos.body: Headline, passion statement, three key messages (and no more), metaphors and analogies, demonstrations, partners, customer endorsement, show and tell.

todos.title: Evangelists
todos.body: Driven by a messianic zeal to create new experiences.

todos.title: Dress
todos.body: Dress appropriately for the culture.  Dress like the leader you want to become, not the position you currently have.

todos.title: Surprise
todos.body: Don't let them expect a surprise every time.

todos.title: Open Posture
todos.body: Don't cross your arms or stand behind a lectern.  Start on stage but don't be afraid to roam around the audience.

todos.title: Have Fun
todos.body: Don't be afraid to entertain and mess with the audience.  Frame things that went wrong as if they were supposed to happen.

todos.title: Bullet Points
todos.body: Do not use.

todos.title: Reading Slides
todos.body: Do not do.

todos.title: Three keys to great presentation
todos.body: Customer wants to be informed, educated, and entertained.

todos.title: Reality distortion field
todos.body: An ability to convince anyone of practically anything.

todos.title: Paper & Pen
todos.body: Always sketch things out first.

todos.title: Holy Shit Moment
todos.body: Always plan for one moment that takes the audience by surprise and amazement.  Ex   Pulling macbook air out of an envelope.  Build up to the moment.
